title: 2.4 Master Challenge 2
question:
Write a program to calculate the electricity bill. Consider an example. A consumer consumes an average of 1400 watts per hour daily for one month. Calculate the total energy bill of that consumer if the per unit rate is $0.25. [Take 1 month = 30 Days].
As we know that 1 Unit = 1 kWh (kilowatt per hour)
So, Wh = 1400 watts x 24 hours x 30 days = 1008000
So, we want to convert into units, where 1 unit = 1 kWh
Total consumed units are as 1008000/1000 = 1008
And, cost per unit is = $0.25, the total cost of the electricity bill is 1008 x $0.25 = $252
Take the inputs from the user using Scanner class and use nested if statements to calculate the electricity bill. Print the statements respectively.
